skill.name: when-orchestrating-swarm-use-swarm-orchestration
skill.description: Complex multi-agent swarm orchestration with task decomposition, distributed execution, and result synthesis
skill.summary: Complex multi-agent swarm orchestration with task decomposition, distributed execution, and result s...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only workflow documentation and bash script examples. No executable code, no file access beyond Claude Flow's own operations, and no direct network calls. All functionality is achieved through documented npx claude-flow commands.

content.value_statement: Complex multi-agent workflows become unmanageable when handled sequentially. This skill provides a structured approach to decompose tasks, coordinate distributed execution across specialized agents, and synthesize results into unified outputs.
actual_capabilities: Decompose complex tasks into hierarchical subtask trees
Initialize swarm infrastructure with optimal topology
Spawn and coordinate specialized agents (researcher, coder, reviewer, tester)
Monitor task execution progress and agent health
Handle task dependencies and rebalance workloads
Synthesize results from multiple agents into unified outputs
limitations: Requires Claude Flow to be installed and configured
Cannot execute without network access to Claude Flow services
Does not handle agent failures beyond documented retry patterns
Limited to text-based workflows; cannot directly process binary files

use_cases.title: Build complex applications
use_cases.description: Coordinate full-stack development across multiple specialized agents with proper task dependencies

use_cases.title: Automate deployment pipelines
use_cases.description: Orchestrate infrastructure setup, testing, and deployment across distributed agent teams

use_cases.title: Track large-scale projects
use_cases.description: Monitor progress across dozens of concurrent tasks and synthesize status reports automatically

prompt_templates.title: Complex project
prompt_templates.prompt: Orchestrate a full-stack web application build using hierarchical topology with 5 researcher, 8 coder, and 3 tester agents

prompt_templates.title: Monitoring focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Run swarm orchestration for feature development and monitor progress every 15 minutes until completion

prompt_templates.title: Custom workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Orchestrate the migration project using adaptive coordination, integrate with CI/CD pipeline, and archive results to storage

output_examples.input: Orchestrate a todo application build with 3 agents
output: Agents spawned: task-orchestrator, hierarchical-coordinator, adaptive-coordinator, 2 researchers, 3 coders, 1 reviewer
Execution: 11 tasks completed, 1 pending (average task time: 2m 45s)
Success rate: 92% - All critical paths completed
Final synthesis: Architecture docs, API implementation, UI components, test suite

best_practices: Break tasks into atomic units of less than 15 minutes of estimated work
Document all dependencies explicitly to enable proper execution ordering
Monitor agent utilization and rebalance workloads when any agent exceeds 90% capacity
anti_patterns: Creating tasks that span multiple responsibilities instead of breaking them down
Ignoring dependency relationships and executing tasks in arbitrary order
Spawning more agents than the swarm can coordinate efficiently (overhead increases dramatically beyond 15 agents)

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Claude Flow must be installed and configured.

faq.question: What are the task limits?
faq.answer: Optimal performance is achieved with 45 or fewer tasks. Larger workloads should be broken into multiple orchestrations.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing tools?
faq.answer: Claude Flow MCP integration allows spawning agents programmatically. Results can be exported to CI/CD and project management tools.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: All execution happens through Claude Flow infrastructure. No data is stored beyond the current orchestration session.

faq.question: What if an agent fails?
faq.answer: The adaptive coordinator attempts task reassignment. Persistent failures trigger alerts in the monitoring phase.

faq.question: How is this different from parallel-swarm-implementation?
faq.answer: Swarm orchestration focuses on hierarchical coordination and result synthesis. Parallel swarm is optimized for concurrent execution without complex dependencies.
